summary: This is an email chain from April 2019 regarding the technical handling of a significant document production in the US v. Epstein case. The emails discuss unzipping and organizing files from a subpoena response by the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner, which were stored on a shared DOJ drive. The correspondence highlights the procedural steps taken to manage evidence during the investigation.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting assistance with unzipping and organizing a document production related to the Epstein case. The signature suggests they are an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Boies Schiller second subpoena response
events.description: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner produced documents in response to a subpoena in the US v. Epstein investigation. This production was received and stored on a shared DOJ drive.

events.title: Additional Boies Schiller production received
events.description: A follow-up, smaller document production from Boies Schiller Flexner was received, prompting a request to process these files similarly to the earlier batch.

locations: Shared drive: \\Usa.doj.gov\ cloud\NYS\ StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618\Investigation\# 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena Returns\ Boies Schiller\
keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from April 2019 concerning the management of evidence in the US v. Epstein case (docket 2018R01618).
It references a 'significant production' of documents, mostly in .zip folders, received from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner in response to a subpoena.
The production was stored on a shared US Department of Justice drive, indicating formal evidence handling procedures.
The correspondence highlights the logistical challenges (unzipping errors) and care taken to preserve document integrity during the investigation.
The email signature identifies the sender as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, confirming prosecutorial involvement.
